articles.title: Are You At Risk Of AI Agency Decay? Take The Test To Find Out
articles.author: Forbes
articles.summary: As our reliance on AI deepens, a significant challenge emerges: AI agency decay. Take the test to asses your own position on the spectrum and counteract AI's negative impact on your job.      Â   i.e. to counter AI's harmful effects.

articles.title: Google DeepMind CEO demonstrates Genie 2, world-building AI model that could train robots
articles.author: Will Croxton
articles.summary: This week, 60 Minutes correspondent Scott Pelley reported on advances in artificial intelligence technology led by Google DeepMind. He took Astra, Google's AI assistant that can see and hear with cameras and microphones, for a test drive on the streets of London. 60 Minutes learned more about advancements in generative AI that produce images, video and 3D interactive environments.

articles.title: What's next in artificial intelligence according to a tech visionary who may hold the cards to our future
articles.author: Scott Pelley
articles.summary: Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis predicts that artificial general intelligence is 5 to 10 years away. Hassabis co-founded DeepMind with John Jumper, who won a Nobel Prize for his work on AI. AI has progressed incredibly fast in recent years and it's challenging to keep up with the advances, Hassabis says.

articles.title: A tech CEO who may hold the cards of our future on what's next for AI
articles.author: Scott Pelley
articles.summary: Demis Hassabis is the CEO of Google DeepMind, which was acquired by Google in 2014. His work on AI led to a Nobel Prize. Hassabis believes artificial general intelligence is 5 to 10 years away. AI will be embedded in everyday lives and develop a sense of imagination, he predicts.

articles.title: Artificial intelligence could end disease, lead to "radical abundance," Google DeepMind CEO Demis Hassabis says
articles.author: Scott
articles.summary: Demis Hassabis won the Nobel Prize last year for his work in artificial intelligence. He is co-founder and CEO of Google's AI powerhouse, called DeepMind. Scott Pelley and Bibo Xu met two years ago when chatbots announced a new age. Astra is an app in a new generation of chatbots that interpret the world with their own eyes.

articles.title: AI could end disease, lead to "radical abundance," head of Google AI predicts
articles.author: Scott Pelley
articles.summary: Demis Hassabis is co-founder and CEO of Google's AI powerhouse, called DeepMind. Scott Pelley and Bibo Xu met two years ago when chatbots announced a new age. They discuss the progress of artificial intelligence and the future of the field.

articles.title: Bizarre ChatGPT trend sees owners find out what their pets look like as humans
articles.author: Sinead Butler
articles.summary: ChatGPT has created a new trend where owners upload photos of their pets to the chatbot and the AI generates an image which imagines them in human form. Reddit users shared their results from the image generation tool and shared their opinion on the tool, which has seen other AI-generated photo trends such as Studio Ghibli, action figures and Harry Potter characters partying.

articles.title: 2027 AGI forecast maps a 24-month sprint to human-level AI
articles.author: Edelman
articles.summary: AI 2027 outlines a quarter-by-quarter progression of anticipated AI capabilities. It is based on assumptions that AI models and applications will continue to progress exponentially. AI that can surpass humans in almost everything will arrive in the next two to three years. There are numerous implications for humanity if AGI does arrive and is followed quickly by ASI. Industries such as customer service, content creation, programming and data analysis could face upheaval before retraining infrastructure can scale.

articles.title: Will AI Make Us Smarter?
articles.author: from
articles.summary: Artificial intelligence has enhanced his life. It makes him feel smarter. AI has bested and dislodged fake experts in academia, nonprofits and corporate life. The gap between elite knowledge and that which can be known instantly by anyone will shrink ever further. It will lead to a restructuring of many industries, among them those that specialize in knowledge dissemination.

articles.title: 2027 AGI forecast maps a 24-month sprint to human-level AI
articles.author: News Feed Editor
articles.summary: AI 2027 scenario was developed by a team of AI researchers and forecasters with experience at institutions like OpenAI and The Center for AI Policy. The most notable prediction is that artificial general intelligence will be achieved in 2027, and artificial superintelligence (ASI) will follow months later.

articles.title: UB launching new academic department focusing on AI and society
articles.author: Cory Nealon
articles.summary: The University at Buffalo is planning to create a new department dedicated to education and research on artificial intelligence and society. Gov. Kathy Hochul announced today that UB will receive $5 million to launch the new department this fall. The funds will be used to purchase high-performance computing and hire additional faculty with expertise in AI.

articles.title: Essay: The A.I. Deception - Leo to Gemini experiment
articles.author: Sober Christian Gentleman
articles.summary: The year 2025 marks a pivotal juncture in human history, when the promise of artificial intelligence has seamlessly woven itself into the fabric of our daily existence. AI has become an undeniable force shaping our interactions and perceptions. It offers unprecedented convenience and efficiency, but it also has the potential for manipulation and misrepresentation. The proliferation of AI-generated fake news and propaganda poses a direct threat to democratic processes.

articles.title: States Newsroom: All Power to AI -- As demand for AI rises, so do energy thirsty data centers
articles.author: Paige Gross
articles.summary: As the United States works to be a global AI superpower, it's become a home to hundreds of data centers, which store and maintain the equipment needed to compute information. Data centers are responsible for about 2% of energy demand in the U.S. The market for data centers has doubled since 2020.

articles.title: The #1 Skill That Pays More Than Gen AI In 2025
articles.author: Rachel Wells
articles.summary: According to Indeed, the number one skill you need in 2025 is communication. Generative AI tools like ChatGPT make it hard to tell what's real and what's fake. AI has helped businesses, creators, and freelance professionals scale faster and produce content more easily, but it's also making it harder for us to trust what we see or develop real human connection.

Cleaning the filter doesn't take much time or energy.

Before Pink's, Martinez ran a medical billing business for five years and worked at Sandia National Laboratories for six years.

articles.title: AI vs. Doom: Humans Still Win
articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: Even the most sophisticated vision-language models are struggling to play classic video games. The most consistent failure across all frontier models was an inability to control the mouse in games like civilization and Warcraft II. This highlights a critical gap in current AI: the ability to translate abstract commands into precise motor actions within a visual surroundings.

articles.author: archyde
articles.summary: April Surac, 17, is a rising senior at West Orange High School in Orange County, Florida. She developed a reading program called Bookoli, which uses AI to assess a user's comprehension while they read and generate tailored questions to reinforce understanding. Surac received the NCWIT Aspirations in Computing Award. She plans to major in electrical engineering and neuroscience at a top engineering school.

articles.title: SoftBank's Son: Big Bets & Heavy Borrowing
articles.author: Archyde News service
articles.summary: SoftBank Group is leading a $40 billion investment in OpenAI, the creator of ChatGPT. This latest investment round values OpenAI at a staggering $300 billion. The move underscores SoftBank's conviction in the transformative potential of AI and its commitment to backing companies at the forefront of innovation. Masayoshi Son's investment philosophy is characterized by a willingness to take calculated risks and bet big on disruptive technologies. SoftBank has invested $6 billion in the first three quarters of this fiscal year and January 2025, compared to $3.9 billion the previous fiscal year.

articles.title: AI Agents As Customers: Rethinking The Marketplace Of The Future

This shift raises ethical and social concerns.

articles.summary: Actors who sold their image rights to AI marketing companies have their digital likenesses used in objectionable ads or propaganda, often misrepresenting them. The contracts offer up to a few thousand euros, depending on duration and how well a person is known. Adam Coy, a 29-year-old actor and director based in New York, signed over the rights to his face and voice to MCM for $1 000 (885 euros) in October 2024.

articles.title: AI might be coming for your job, but it can't take your creativity

articles.author: The Times/The Sunday Times
articles.summary: In November 2022, the San Francisco-based OpenAI released ChatGPT. The AI chatbot was able to generate lengthy text responses to complicated questions. Sam Altman, OpenAI's chief executive and co-founder, doesn't have super-voting shares in the company.

articles.title: AI in focus with upcoming 10-Year Higher Education plan
articles.author: The Star
articles.summary: A new 10-year education plan focusing on new technology, especially artificial intelligence (AI), will be launched, says Higher Education deputy minister Datuk Mustapha Sakmud. Read full story at: www.dailymail.co.uk/education-news/

articles.title: Scientists use AI to reveal the neural dynamics of human conversation
articles.author: Suryaa
articles.summary: Researchers have been able to track the language exchanged during conversations and the corresponding neural activity in different brain regions using artificial intelligence and electrical recordings of brain activity. The team is from Department of Department of Computer Science at the University of New York's Graduate School of Information Technology.

articles.title: ‘AI a challenge for old education system in Third World countries'
articles.author: The News International
articles.summary: Principals, school owners and experts in education and science & technology from public and private schools across Sindh have unanimously emphasized that artificial intelligence (AI) has become a challenge for them. The picture shows a computer chip with "AI" written on top of it.
